roleset.name: Fill, attach, or fix with gum or gum-like substance

role.descr: First (or all in one constituent) thing gummed
Thing arg1 is attached to with gum (when separate constituent)
Gum itself, type of gum used, instrument

example.name: No instrument, type of gum mentioned
example.text: [I]-1 sewed the glasses on, and *PRO*-1 gummed the mustache to my face.

example.name: With PP "on"
example.text: The buds looked as if [they]-1 were gummed *-1 on to the lower side of the leaves.
example.arg: on to the lower side of the leaves

example.name: All arguments, invented example
example.text: John gummed the handle to the toaster oven with cherry Big-League chew.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB and sense groupings. VN class 22.4-1. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: To chew without gums

example.name: With secondary predication
example.text: She gummed the apple to death.

example.name: Connative
example.text: The old man gummed at his wine-cup.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB and sense groupings. Framed by Claire. VN entry chew-39.2-1.

roleset.name: Make sticky, metaphorically make a sticky situation

example.name: Literal, passive
example.text: [The carbs]-1 are gummed *-1 up inside, and need to be aired out and cleaned.

example.name: Metaphorical, active.
example.text: He's gummed up Atlantic City joint ventures in the past.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB and sense groupings. Framed by Claire. No appropriate VN class found.
